result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica K Lentz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Agent to Determine; Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.   No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. DNA Sample to be provided if not yet previously done.  No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
 If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber non working hours.  Last 10 days STAYED to be used at Agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  May be served in Milwaukee County but the Court DOES NOT authorize electronic monitoring.  Defendant to report to the Huber Facility by 5:00 pm on Monday, May 9, 2016.
To be performed as a condition of probation.
